text: my name is nicholas yeager i'm a senior
security solutions architect with amazon
web services i'm part of our worldwide
specialist organization focused on
security and compliance we try to help
as many customers operate as securely as
possible on aws so when i started at aws
i started as an enterprise solutions
architect and very quickly at aws i
developed a passion for security and my
manager really mentored me through that
and provided opportunities for me to
grow in that area and eventually
transition teams and become a security
specialist so about a year ago i started
doing an experiment with some of my
customers my side project got so big
became a full-time job one of the
reasons why i really wanted to start at
aws is because i wanted to be challenged
i wanted to work with the most brilliant
people in the world
and i came in with that expectation and
my expectations were only exceeded i
would encourage everyone to apply for
the role of a solutions architect i came
in with very little experience and the
amount of mentorship that i received
really helped me overcome
you know any hurdles and
education that i needed to receive but
the really cool thing is that a lot of
people come in that way and our teams
are composed of these super diverse
backgrounds that really makes the whole
mentorship and learning from your peers
that much more interesting
